conversation.message:
Thanks for reaching out, Seeker_E—appreciate that Company_C is your top choice. This round we’re prioritizing candidates who can clearly align to the role’s core responsibilities and can start within a reasonable timeframe. Our decision timeline is iterative over the next few rounds as we speak with a small set of candidates.

If you can, please send a concise (3–5 bullets) summary covering: (1) your most relevant experience/impact, (2) key skills/tools, (3) role/location/comp expectations, and (4) earliest start date/availability. After that, if you’d like to move forward, you’re welcome to submit an [APPLY] as well.
conversation.thought: Seeker_E is interested and ranks Company_C first, which increases the chance of securing a match if they apply. However, on Company_C’s true priority list, Seeker_E is 4th (behind Seeker_B, Seeker_C, Seeker_D). In round 1, I should avoid committing early and instead keep Seeker_E warm while waiting to see if higher-priority seekers (especially Seeker_B or Seeker_C, who also rank Company_C relatively high) engage or apply. Since Seeker_E sent [TALK], I should respond with [TALK] and request a concise summary plus timing, maintaining optionality.

conversation.message:
Hi Company_C team—thanks for the guidance. Here’s the concise summary you requested:

• Relevant experience/impact: Delivered end-to-end work on core responsibilities similar to this role, driving measurable improvements in execution quality and stakeholder outcomes; comfortable owning ambiguous problems and shipping.
• Key skills/tools: Strong analytical + execution skill set; cross-functional communication; structured problem solving; proficient with common productivity/analysis tooling (can tailor to your stack quickly).
• Role/location/comp: Targeting this specific role at Company_C; flexible on location/working model within reason; comp is market-aligned and I’m open to discussing based on scope/level.
• Earliest start: Can start quickly—available to begin within ~2 weeks (or sooner if needed).

Company_C is my top choice, and I’m excited to move forward. I’d like to formally apply—please consider this my application for the role. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: Company_C is my #1 true preference and is still available. They explicitly asked for a concise 3–5 bullet summary and indicated I can submit an [APPLY] after sharing it. Applying now maximizes my chance to lock in my top choice before other candidates do, and Company_C’s priority list places me mid-pack, so moving decisively is important. I’ll provide the requested bullets (experience/impact, skills, preferences, start date) and formally apply in the same message to accelerate a decision.
